verses.verse: Hear <WH8085> ye now what the LORD <WH3068> saith <WH559>; Arise <WH6965>, contend <WH7378> thou before the mountains <WH2022>, and let the hills <WH1389> hear <WH8085> thy voice <WH6963>. before: or, with

Hear <WH8085> ye, O mountains <WH2022>, the LORD'S <WH3068> controversy <WH7379>, and ye strong <WH386> foundations <WH4146> of the earth <WH776>: for the LORD <WH3068> hath a controversy <WH7379> with his people <WH5971>, and he will plead <WH3198> with Israel <WH3478>.
O my people <WH5971>, what have I done <WH6213> unto thee? and wherein have I wearied <WH3811> thee? testify <WH6030> against me.

For I brought thee up <WH5927> out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>, and redeemed <WH6299> thee out of the house <WH1004> of servants <WH5650>; and I sent <WH7971> before <WH6440> thee Moses <WH4872>, Aaron <WH175>, and Miriam <WH4813>.

O my people <WH5971>, remember <WH2142> now what Balak <WH1111> king <WH4428> of Moab <WH4124> consulted <WH3289>, and what Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> answered <WH6030> him from Shittim <WH7851> unto Gilgal <WH1537>; that ye may know <WH3045> the righteousness <WH6666> of the LORD <WH3068>.

Wherewith shall I come before <WH6923> the LORD <WH3068>, and bow <WH3721> myself before the high <WH4791> God <WH430>? shall I come before <WH6923> him with burnt offerings <WH5930>, with calves <WH5695> of a year <WH8141> old <WH1121>? of a: Heb. sons of a year?

Will the LORD <WH3068> be pleased <WH7521> with thousands <WH505> of rams <WH352>, or with ten thousands <WH7233> of rivers <WH5158> of oil <WH8081>? shall I give <WH5414> my firstborn <WH1060> for my transgression <WH6588>, the fruit <WH6529> of my body <WH990> for the sin <WH2403> of my soul <WH5315>? body: Heb. belly

He hath shewed <WH5046> thee, O man <WH120>, what is good <WH2896>; and what doth the LORD <WH3068> require <WH1875> of thee, but to do <WH6213> justly <WH4941>, and to love <WH160> mercy <WH2617>, and to walk <WH3212> humbly <WH6800> with thy God <WH430>? walk: Heb. humble thyself to walk

The LORD'S <WH3068> voice <WH6963> crieth <WH7121> unto the city <WH5892>, and the man of wisdom <WH8454> shall see <WH7200> thy name <WH8034>: hear <WH8085> ye the rod <WH4294>, and who hath appointed <WH3259> it. the man: or, thy name shall see that which is

Are there <WH786> yet the treasures <WH214> of wickedness <WH7562> <WH376> in the house <WH1004> of the wicked <WH7563>, and the scant <WH7332> measure <WH374> that is abominable <WH2194>? Are: or, Is there yet unto every man an house of the, etc scant: Heb. measure of leanness
Shall I count them pure <WH2135> with the wicked <WH7562> balances <WH3976>, and with the bag <WH3599> of deceitful <WH4820> weights <WH68>? count: or, be pure with, etc

For the rich men <WH6223> thereof are full <WH4390> of violence <WH2555>, and the inhabitants <WH3427> thereof have spoken <WH1696> lies <WH8267>, and their tongue <WH3956> is deceitful <WH7423> in their mouth <WH6310>.
Therefore also will I make thee sick <WH2470> in smiting <WH5221> thee, in making thee desolate <WH8074> because of thy sins <WH2403>.

Thou shalt eat <WH398>, but not be satisfied <WH7646>; and thy casting down <WH3445> shall be in the midst <WH7130> of thee; and thou shalt take hold <WH5253>, but shalt not deliver <WH6403>; and that which thou deliverest <WH6403> will I give up <WH5414> to the sword <WH2719>.

Thou shalt sow <WH2232>, but thou shalt not reap <WH7114>; thou shalt tread <WH1869> the olives <WH2132>, but thou shalt not anoint <WH5480> thee with oil <WH8081>; and sweet wine <WH8492>, but shalt not drink <WH8354> wine <WH3196>.

For the statutes <WH2708> of Omri <WH6018> are kept <WH8104>, and all the works <WH4639> of the house <WH1004> of Ahab <WH256>, and ye walk <WH3212> in their counsels <WH4156>; that I should make <WH5414> thee a desolation <WH8047>, and the inhabitants <WH3427> thereof an hissing <WH8322>: therefore ye shall bear <WH5375> the reproach <WH2781> of my people <WH5971>. For the: or, For he doth much keep the, etc desolation: or, astonishment
